meanings.definition: A personal name given to an individual in ancient Rome, typically used as a first name.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, each person had a praenomens that distinguished them.
meanings.sent2: The praenomens of the Romans often reflected their family traditions.
meanings.sent3: I wonder what my praenomens would be if I lived in ancient Rome!
meanings.sent4: Her praenomens shone brightly among the names of her peers.
meanings.sent5: The praenomens were like colorful flags waving in the Roman society.

meanings.definition: The first of the three names in the Roman naming system, consisting of the praenomen, nomen, and cognomen.
meanings.sent1: The praenomens played a crucial role in identifying individuals in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent2: When learning about Roman names, one must understand the significance of praenomens.
meanings.sent3: The praenomens, nomen, and cognomen walked into a bar - the bartender asked for their IDs!
meanings.sent4: His praenomens stood tall like a pillar in the structure of his identity.
meanings.sent5: Among the three names, the praenomens stood out like a shining star in the night sky.
